intro: Borreria dimorpha, commonly known as the redroot false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields. Borreria dimorpha is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
